item.title: How I learned to time travel, or, data pipelining and scheduling with Airflow
item.description:
Description

PyData DC 2016

Slides: http://www.slideshare.net/PyData/how-i-learned-to-time-travel-or-data-pipelining-and-scheduling-with-airflow-67650418

Data warehousing and analytics projects can, like ours, start out small - and fragile. With an organically growing mess of scripts glued together and triggered by cron jobs hiding on different servers, we needed better plumbing. After perusing the data pipelining landscape, we landed on Airflow, an Apache incubating batch processing pipelining and scheduler tool from Airbnb.
item.dc:creator: Laura Lorenz

item.title: Natural Language Processing with NLTK and Gensim
item.description:
Description

Speakers: Tony Ojeda, Benjamin Bengfort, Laura Lorenz

In this tutorial, we will begin by exploring the features of the NLTK library. We will then focus on building a language-aware data product - a topic identification and document clustering algorithm from a web crawl of blog sites. The clustering algorithm will use a simple Lesk K-Means clustering to start, and then will improve with an LDA analysis using the popular Gensim library.

Slides can be found at: https://speakerdeck.com/pycon2016 and https://github.com/PyCon/2016-slides
item.dc:creator: Tony Ojeda
